summary: Why does these anons and so called "Sansa fans" try their best to make us hate Sophie? Are they already giving up from trying to...
question: Why does these anons and so called "Sansa fans" try their best to make us hate Sophie? Are they already giving up from trying to make us hate Sansa? So, now they go around making up things and projecting their feelings to mislead and make us hate Sophie. These happened in another Sansa fans blogs as well. They  must think Sansa fans are so stupid and gullible. Why are they so threatened with Sansa and Sophie? It's not like Sansa and Sophie have massive fandoms.
answer: Honestly, a lot of them got to me earlier by claiming Sophie is a bad actor even though I thought she was decent. I know Sansans and co think she’s rubbish and doesn’t understand Sansa, I have seen Arya/Stark stans make that claim too. Sophie has really been getting a lot of love lately and it must bother them after years of bullying her

Sophie has really been getting a lot of love lately and it must bother them after years of bullying her

summary: You know what has annoyed me the last two seasons is that Sansa got hate because many assumed she was conspiring against Jon and...
question: You know what has annoyed me the last two seasons is that Sansa got hate because many assumed she was conspiring against Jon and later Arya with LF. Yet, Jon has now bent the knee to Dany and Arya threatened her that is totally fine. It's amazing her siblings can do whatever but if Sansa's left eye twitches funny she "will betray her family!!!" It's frustrating because she isn't doing anything.
answer: This is why our fanbase is so protective. People will look for any excuse to tear Sansa down even if she’s doing everything they want her to do. It’s funny because one of the reasons people gave for disliking queen Sansa was that she would allow southerners to control the North and then Jon knelt to a southerner. They also said she’d kill her family for power and then Arya threatened to skin her alive. Yet somehow it’s all Sansa’s fault.

reblog.comment: This is why our fanbase is so protective. People will look for any excuse to tear Sansa down even if she’s doing everything they want her to do. It’s funny because one of the reasons people gave for disliking queen Sansa was that she would allow southerners to control the North and then Jon knelt to a southerner. They also said she’d kill her family for power and then Arya threatened to skin her alive. Yet somehow it’s all Sansa’s fault.

They also said she’d kill her family for power and then Arya threatened to skin her alive. Yet somehow it’s all Sansa’s fault.

They also said she’d kill her family for power and then Arya threatened to skin her alive. Yet somehow it’s all Sansa’s fault.

tags: Personal finance lessons from the game of thrones
summary: Personal finance lessons from the game of thrones
title: Personal finance lessons from the game of thrones
body:
Game of Thrones is not just any TV show. It is a mesmerising tale of a fantasy that is beyond your imagination. The characters, plots and their histories are intriguing and convoluted at the same time. The writers know how to throw unexpected sequences at the audience and keep them hooked.

As the world gears up for its last season to release in April, we drew a few comparisons between the show and personal finance. Read along to know what we are talking about.

Lesson 1: Winter is coming.

Everyone in the series, from the north to the south, is shown preparing for a long-drawn winter season. This imaginative cold spell typically lasts for years and not months. The kingdom rulers are often shown taking stock of their current reserves. They even talk of cutting down on expenditure to prepare for the harsh winters.

It is similar to creating an emergency fund to prepare for exigencies or saving up for a retirement fund. You never know when an emergency may hit your life, and your savings are the only way to sail through such situations.

Lesson 2: A Lannister always pays his debts.

Whether it is about taking revenge or reciprocating acts of kindness, the Lannisters are known to settle the scores. It is a way of depicting the dependability and competence of the Lannisters.

When it comes to managing personal finances, you may have to take debts to fulfil your needs. However, it is essential to be regular with your monthly instalments. This practice can give you a healthy credit score and improve your chances of availing future loans.

Lesson 3: I did warn you not to trust me.

This is a famous quote by ‘Little Finger’ who is known for his deceit and con tricks. He puts on a mask of goodness and betrays people when they are least expecting it.

In personal finance, you can draw parallels with your investments. Several instruments in the market come with substantial risk. For example - real estate and stocks are risky investments, and you never know when the market will change its course. It is advisable to invest in them only after evaluating your risk appetite and tolerance.

Lesson 4: Diversification.

Game of Thrones sends out a clear message about the virtues of various armies. Both Jon Snow and Daenerys Targaryen have built different fighting forces. Daenerys has men who were previous slaves, men belonging to a nomadic tribe and fire-breathing dragons. Similarly, Jon Snow has allied with the wildlings, while respecting the power of women, thus showing versatile armies with varied strengths.

Experts have always maintained that the investment portfolio must be diversified. It spreads your risk exposure and optimises your returns. For example - mutual funds give great returns while fixed deposits ensure safety. It is also recommended to choose options that let you enjoy the power of compounding.

Conclusion

Taking cues from your favourite TV series, you can strengthen your financial health with these analogies.

summary: D&D are promoting starkbowl again. Liam in the interview said that Sansa distrust Jon is not delighted with Dany. I hope she...
question: D&D are promoting starkbowl again. Liam in the interview said that Sansa distrust Jon is not delighted with Dany. I hope she will be not the only one, cause it's only natural reaction to the mess Jon created. He failed with Cersei, thanks to him NK has a dragon and the wall felt, slept with his political ally. I can't with him. But I'm afraid D&D make Sansa the only person who will question his decisions and be not so happy with Dany's presence. I don't think Jon will have any problems.
answer: It takes so little effort to promote Starkbowl, people will run with it as far as they can stretch it. It’s almost funny but yeah Sansa has been displeased with Jon ever since she read his letter explaining that he knelt to Dany. It’s not new information, we read about it in the first EW article of the season, we saw it in the second teaser and I think it’s in the episode synopsis they release for ep 1. Sansa distrusting Jon makes sense, it’s a consequence of his actions but watch his stans scream about Sansa’s ambition.

summary:
Game of Thrones - Die komplette 5. Staffel 
Game of Thrones - Die komplette 5. Staffel beginnt mit der Totenfeier für Lord...
caption:
Game of Thrones - Die komplette 5. Staffel
Game of Thrones - Die komplette 5. Staffel beginnt mit der Totenfeier für Lord Tywin und Cerseis verzweifeltem Versuch mit Hilfe der religiösen Splittergruppe der Spatzen ihre Macht gegenüber Margaery Tyrell zu bewahren. Lord Varys offenbart Tyrion Lannister seine wahren Absichten und Daenerys Targaryen muss sich in Meereen gegenüber den Söhnen der Harpyie beweisen.

Game of Thrones - Die komplette 5. Staffel
Game of Thrones - Die komplette 5. Staffel beginnt mit der Totenfeier für Lord Tywin und Cerseis verzweifeltem Versuch mit Hilfe der religiösen Splittergruppe der Spatzen ihre Macht gegenüber Margaery Tyrell zu bewahren. Lord Varys offenbart Tyrion Lannister seine wahren Absichten und Daenerys Targaryen muss sich in Meereen gegenüber den Söhnen der Harpyie beweisen.
